message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of fusing visual and inertial sensory data to infer three-dimensional motion, which is a common problem in robotics and autonomous systems. The focus of the paper is on robust filtering, which is a technique used in robotics and control systems to deal with outliers and uncertainties in sensor data. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.RO (Robotics), followed by cs.CV (Computer Vision) since the paper deals with visual data. The paper also proposes several approximations for the optimal discriminant, which involves machine learning and statistical techniques, so cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.SY (Systems and Control) are also likely categories. Finally, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is a possible category since the paper deals with the problem of inferring motion from sensor data, which is a common problem in AI applications such as autonomous driving and robotics.
